result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas L Avery

records.addlTxt: Conceal Carry Weapons Course Certificate of Completion.

2:42 PM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Nicholas L Avery in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for Nicholas L Avery.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Simon provides an update; he was just appointed he is still waiting on discovery.  Atty. Simon requests another further proceedings in about 45 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Repayment at the rate of $300.00 per month commencing 10/01/2022. Court appoints Attorney Simon under the Waukesha County Capitation Contract. (BC)

1:54 PM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Nicholas L Avery in court.  Court reviews the case on the record and notes the Judge at the time denied the petition for court appointed attorney and inquires if the defendant has retained private counsel.  Defendant advises that he has not been able to afford a private attorney, he contacted about 4 attorneys.  Court inquires if the defendant's financial circumstances have changed.  Defendant advises they have not but notes his work is seasonal.  Given the new information the Court will now grant the petition for court appointed attorney.  Court will order repayment at $300.00/month with the first payment due by 10/01/2022.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel in about 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Denied and signed by Judge Todd K Martens August 26, 2022.

2:02 PM; Case called for Hearing.   Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Nicholas L Avery in court. Court reviews the case on the record and notes the matter was adjourned to allow time for defendant to get an attorney.  Defendant advises he did not qualify for a Public Defender and filed a petition for court appointed attorney.  Court has reviewed the petition and finds the defendant is not indigent and denies the petition for court appointed attorney.  Court inquires if the defendant plans to retain private counsel.  Defendant needs time to retain private counsel.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel in 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  **Reviewed by Judge Martens 8/26/22 - Petition denied.**

**Re-reviewed by Judge Reilly at the 9/26/2022 hearing - petition granted, court orders repayment at $300.00/month with the first payment due by 10/01/2022.**
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 01:39 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Nicholas L Avery in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews the case on the record and inquires if the defendant has retained counsel.  Defendant advises he plans to proceed pro se.  Atty. Gordon recites the offer. Defendant advises he believes he has proof of completion of what he needed to resolve the matter today.  Documents are provided to the State.  Atty. Gordon confirms defendant has completed the conceal carry course.  Atty. Gordon needs more time to review the the file before the matter can proceed to plea and sentencing.  Court reminds the defendant is the offer is to still plea to the charge so he would still be charged criminally.  Court again inquires if the defendant would like to retain counsel in this matter.  Defendant advises he will report to the Public Defender's office to see if he qualfies for representation.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

10:03 AM Defendant Nicholas L Avery in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
